test.query_clob:
select a1.pass_yn, 
       a1.application_id,  
			 null child_code,
       a1.authorization_scheme,
			 null page_id,
       a1.created_by, 
       a1.created_on, 
       a1.last_updated_by, 
       a1.last_updated_on,
       case when a1.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a1.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc
            end as issue_title,
			 a1.application_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 a1.workspace
from (
    select 
    case when aa.authorization_scheme is null
        then 'N'
        else 'Y'
        end as pass_yn,
    aa.application_id,
    aa.authorization_scheme,
    aa.created_by, 
    aa.created_on, 
    aa.last_updated_by, 
    aa.last_updated_on,
    apex_string.format( p_message => q'^Application %0 is missing an Authorization scheme^',
                        p0        => aa.application_id
    ) issue_desc,
	  aa.workspace
    from v_svt_apex_applications aa
    where aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
) a1
test.explanation:
\[Applications have authorization schemes\]  
Applications should have application-level authorization schemes as a matter of best-practice
test.fix: Specify an authorization scheme for your application. Application authorization schemes are defined for an application for the purpose of controlling access. Setting a required authorization scheme here at the application level will require all pages of the application to pass the defined authorization check.
